channel.title: NPR All Things Considered
channel.description: All Things Considered hosts Ailsa Chang, Mary Louise Kelly, Ari Shapiro, Juana Summers and Scott Detrow present the program's trademark mix of news, interviews, commentaries, reviews, and offbeat features 7 days a week.

item.title: Biden's cancer diagnosis underscores question at the heart of new book 'Original Sin'
item.description: NPR's Scott Detrow speaks with CNN Anchor Jake Tapper and Axios reporter Alex Thompson about their new book Original Sin.

item.title: USAID cuts are even being felt at high school science fairs
item.description: Cuts to USAID have consequences big and small, reaching all the way down to high school science fairs in the U.S.

item.title: How the Israeli Druze community is reacting to their government's campaign in Syria
item.description: Israeli Druze are watching their government's pressure campaign in Syria. Israel says recent airstrikes inside Syria are to protect the Druze religious minority there from sectarian violence.

item.title: Military recruiting numbers are up, but the rise started before the election
item.description: After a post-pandemic crisis, military recruiters are on a winning streak again. What's behind the turnaround?

item.title: A lot of volunteers are helping with Kentucky storm cleanup
item.description: People have come from around the country to help storm victims in the small town of London, Kentucky where 17 people died after tornadoes' swept through on Friday.

item.title: Manhunt still underway for New Orleans prison escapees
item.description: A manhunt is still underway for 7 inmates who escaped a Louisiana prison last week. Officials are raising questions.

item.title: America has plenty of open manufacturing jobs â€” companies say they can't fill them
item.description: President Trump has been upending the global economy in the name of bringing back American manufacturing jobs. But American manufacturers say they're struggling to fill jobs that already exist.

item.title: What it means to have prostate cancer today
item.description: Former President Biden's diagnosis spotlights both advances and challenges with the disease.

item.title: A former teen parent shares his gratitude to the principal who insisted he graduate
item.description: When Jon Hegwood was a junior in high school, he had a new baby and two jobs, while also going to classes. He was overwhelmed. Someone encouraged him to continue his dreams.

item.title: These photos capture the wonder of scientists in action
item.description: The science magazine Nature announced the results of its annual Scientist at Work photography contest. The winning entries are dramatic, intimate portraits of research.
